reasoning: Reporting incidence of metastatic SCC (~8.5 per 100k globally). SCC includes cutaneous and non-cutaneous types with different metastatic rates. Cutaneous SCC is common but rarely metastatic (~2-5% of cases). Non-cutaneous SCC (head/neck, esophageal) shows higher metastatic potential. Estimate combines both types.
source: Cormack GC. (2005). Cutaneous malignancy: a comprehensive review of surgical treatment. Clin Exp Dermatol. 30(3):209-214
